author: plainview_
content: Well, that sucked.

author: plainview_
content: It has been a surreal 48 hours.  I have stories I can share later, but quick bottom line is that family & I are safe & dry.

author: plainview_
content: That makes us exceptionally fortunate relative to many of our friends & neighbors, many who we've taken in over the last few days.

author: plainview_
content: Myself, friends & neighbors are even fortunate still compared to North & East Houston.  I can't overstate the devastation up there.

author: plainview_
content: My ER doc / SWAT physician neighbor got called yday to help with extraction & rescue.  They needed this to get him… https://t.co/ET3LkZcU9H

author: plainview_
content: in a few hours, he pulled hundreds from homes & on their roofs with 4-5' of water.  It's Katrina-level bad, and worse than on tv.

author: plainview_
content: Roads are impassable so news cant get there; imagine will start to see helicopter footage now with better weather.

author: plainview_
content: But like I said - stories will come.  Here to recruit help.

author: plainview_
content: (sorry just took a phone call on this topic)

author: plainview_
content: OK - back.  Just secured an 18,000sqft warehouse and multiple trucks of sheetrock.

author: plainview_
content: Supplies will be an issue. Once roads reopen & HD/Lowes opens, there will be a run on supplies. Trucks will come & sell out quickly.

author: plainview_
content: Contractors & suppliers will start gouging and raking people who are sitting in bombed-out houses or hotels.

author: plainview_
content: My guess is 400-500,000 homes flooded.

author: plainview_
content: So I'm trying to secure supplies for these people to rebuild.  Sheetrock, mud, tape, nails, insulation.

author: plainview_
content: Anyone able, I will fly you to Dallas, or Oklahoma, or NM/CO/KS - wherever - to load up a Uhaul with this stuff & get it here.

author: plainview_
content: DM me with ideas & ability.  Work from there.

author: plainview_
content: We just took all of our Street's excess bottled water to shelters. Bags & bags of clothes.

author: plainview_
content: I have no idea why i watched water lap up against my doorstep but none came inside - but everyone around me flooded.

author: plainview_
content: I had a family + their elderly neighbor delivered to me by boat.  to my front steps. https://t.co/LD3p5dHrsm

author: plainview_
content: I dont know what else to do, but I won't just sit here. I got too lucky to do nothing.

author: plainview_
content: @NACMtrader17 you're ATX correct?  my analyst evac to ATX & cant return. Brazos & Colorado like 20' above banks? I1… https://t.co/YiH5KjRHxk

author: plainview_
content: @crossdefault insanely fortunate.  thx.

author: plainview_
content: @LadyFOHF not for long, but high & dry now.

author: plainview_
content: @theoscarwhiskey dude, how are you?  where are you in town?

author: plainview_
content: @pcdunham thx. man I've got a story that gave me some perspective on how Katrina may have been for you. Hope it steers clear of you next.

author: plainview_
content: @dougtee thx man. I'm sure the big sites need money badly but I'll find out more. Supplies def my focus so anyone you know - big help.

author: plainview_
content: @AsifSuria news crews didnt know where to go/couldnt get there. neighbors stories opened my eyes - i didnt even know.

author: plainview_
content: @ChloeDenmark YES.  driers needed before the sheet rock & insulation.

author: plainview_
content: @eriz35 It's staggering.  Buffalo bayou getting worse & Addicks spilling

author: plainview_
content: @eriz35 DM me - it would be needed.  Non-gouging labor will be tight. Am coordinating with two builders.

author: plainview_
content: @Frank_McG @Schtaunkhauser @conorsen even I lost a car. Luckily rented a truck Friday before & it's fine.  Been very busy.

author: plainview_
content: @JohnDOrtiz from what area?  want to check availability of supplies.  thank you sir.

author: plainview_
content: @LongHallOwl all of that is perfect.  the stuff that will immediately be in short supply when the stores/roads reop… https://t.co/weU2vuYOtz

author: plainview_
content: @PConnery your area looks devastated; that's where my neighbor went.  will do.
